vision: Become the definitive open-source Go ecosystem for building production-grade AI agents, providing composable infrastructure for LLMs, secrets management, search, retrieval, voice, and observability that enables developers to ship secure, observable, multi-provider AI applications in days instead of months.

values.name: Modularity
values.description: Each component solves one problem well - independent, focused modules that compose elegantly

values.name: Security by Default
values.description: Posture checks, credential gating, and encryption built-in from the start

values.name: Provider Agnostic
values.description: Interface-based design enabling pluggable backends without vendor lock-in

values.name: Observability First
values.description: Hooks and tracing built into every component for production visibility

values.name: Zero External Dependencies
values.description: Core libraries maintain minimal dependencies for reliability and security

methods.name: Complete OmniLLM as the unified LLM abstraction layer
methods.description: Finalize OmniLLM as the production-ready unified SDK for OpenAI, Anthropic, Google Gemini, X.AI Grok, Ollama, and AWS Bedrock with streaming, memory, and observability hooks.

measures.name: Provider coverage
measures.description: Support all major LLM providers with unified interface

obstacles.name: Provider API inconsistencies
obstacles.description: Each provider has different streaming, tool calling, and response formats
obstacles.mitigation: Adapter pattern with comprehensive normalization layer

methods.name: Establish OmniObserve as the LLM observability standard
methods.description: Complete the vendor-agnostic LLM observability framework supporting Opik, Langfuse, and Phoenix with unified tracing, evaluation, and dataset management.

obstacles.name: Backend API differences
obstacles.description: Each observability platform has different trace/span models
obstacles.mitigation: Common semantic conventions with backend-specific adapters

methods.name: Launch OmniRetrieve for production RAG
methods.description: Complete the unified retrieval library supporting Vector RAG, Graph RAG, and Hybrid strategies with pgvector, Pinecone, and Neo4j providers.

obstacles.name: Graph RAG complexity
obstacles.description: Graph-based retrieval requires different query patterns and index strategies
obstacles.mitigation: Start with simple traversal, iterate to more complex graph algorithms

methods.name: Build OmniVoice for voice AI applications
methods.description: Complete the voice AI abstraction layer supporting TTS, STT, and Voice Agents with ElevenLabs, Twilio, and WebRTC transports.

obstacles.name: Real-time audio complexity
obstacles.description: Voice requires low-latency streaming with careful buffer management
obstacles.mitigation: Start with WebSocket, add WebRTC, partner with Twilio for PSTN

methods.name: Mature OmniVault ecosystem
methods.description: Complete the unified secret management ecosystem with AWS, 1Password, and native OS keyring support, plus Swift UI for macOS.

measures.name: Provider coverage
measures.target: 8 providers (add HashiCorp Vault, Azure Key Vault, GCP Secret Manager)

obstacles.name: Cross-platform keyring differences
obstacles.description: macOS Keychain, Windows Credential Manager, and Linux Secret Service have different APIs
obstacles.mitigation: oscompat package abstractions with graceful fallbacks

methods.name: Establish AgentKit as the agent development standard
methods.description: Complete AgentKit as the production-ready framework for building A2A Protocol agents with multi-cloud deployment (Kubernetes, AWS AgentCore).

measures.name: Boilerplate reduction
measures.description: Lines of code eliminated per agent project

methods.name: Build developer community and adoption
methods.description: Grow the AgentPlexus community through documentation, examples, blog posts, and reference implementations.

measures.name: Documentation coverage
measures.target: Full API docs + tutorials for all components

obstacles.name: Discoverability in crowded AI space
obstacles.description: Many AI frameworks competing for developer attention
obstacles.mitigation: Focus on Go ecosystem (underserved), emphasize security and observability differentiators

obstacles.name: Go ecosystem maturity for AI
obstacles.description: AI/ML ecosystem in Go is less mature than Python, requiring more foundational work
obstacles.mitigation: Focus on areas where Go excels (performance, concurrency, deployment) and provide bridges to Python tools

obstacles.name: Rapid LLM provider API changes
obstacles.description: LLM providers frequently change APIs, adding new features and deprecating old ones
obstacles.mitigation: Abstraction layer insulates users; version providers independently; automated compatibility testing

obstacles.name: Resource constraints (open source project)
obstacles.description: Limited contributor time for comprehensive testing and documentation
obstacles.mitigation: Prioritize ruthlessly; automated testing; community contributions

projects.name: OmniLLM Mistral Provider
projects.description: Add Mistral AI as a supported provider

projects.name: OmniLLM Cohere Provider
projects.description: Add Cohere as a supported provider

projects.name: OmniLLM Token Counting
projects.description: Implement accurate token counting across providers

projects.name: OmniObserve OpenTelemetry Export
projects.description: Add OTLP export for standard observability pipelines

projects.name: OmniRetrieve Neo4j Provider
projects.description: Add Neo4j for Graph RAG support

projects.name: OmniVoice ElevenLabs Integration
projects.description: Complete ElevenLabs TTS and voice agent support

projects.name: AgentKit Terraform Templates
projects.description: Add Terraform IaC support for multi-cloud deployment

projects.name: Stats Agent Team v2.0
projects.description: Enhanced reference implementation with full A2A protocol

projects.name: AgentPlexus Documentation Site
projects.description: Comprehensive documentation with tutorials and API reference
